articles.headline: Violence Leaves Young Iraqis Doubting Clerics
articles.snippet: Many young people in Iraq have grown disillusioned with religious leaders and skeptical of the faith that they preach.
articles.abstract: Many young people in Iraq have grown disillusioned with religious leaders and skeptical of the faith that they preach.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD  After almost five years of war, many young people in Iraq, exhausted by constant firsthand exposure to the violence of religious extremism, say they have grown disillusioned with religious leaders and skeptical of the faith that they preach.

articles.headline: Bundled Mortgages and Dubious Fees Complicate Foreclosure Cases
articles.snippet: When Ohioans head to the polls Tuesday, Mark and Gina Wellman of Circleville, Ohio, will be watching another vote — what buyers are bidding for their home.
articles.abstract: When Ohioans head to the polls Tuesday, Mark and Gina Wellman of Circleville, Ohio, will be watching another vote — what buyers are bidding for their home.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Ohioans head to the polls Tuesday to vote in one of the nation’s most scrutinized presidential primaries, Mark and Gina Wellman of Circleville, Ohio, will be watching another vote  what buyers are bidding for the house they built themselves when it goes on the sheriff’s auction block.

articles.headline: The Refrain That Follows Bronfman
articles.snippet: A trail of deals done, and a deal with EMI that was not done.
articles.abstract: A trail of deals done, and a deal with EMI that was not done.
articles.lead_paragraph: For a brief, shining moment, Edgar Bronfman Jr. had redeemed himself.

articles.headline: Vehicle Sales Fell by 10% Last Month
articles.snippet: Sales of cars and trucks in the United States fell 10 percent in February as oil prices climbed past $100 a barrel and worries about a recession rattled consumer confidence.
articles.abstract: Sales of cars and trucks in the United States fell 10 percent in February as oil prices climbed past $100 a barrel and worries about a recession rattled consumer confidence.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  Sales of cars and trucks in the United States fell 10 percent in February as oil prices climbed past $100 a barrel and worries about a recession rattled consumer confidence.

articles.headline: Democratic Rivals Clash Before Pivotal Primaries
articles.snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton accused Barack Obama of deception and faulted his Senate record as new evidence of discord surfaced within her own camp.
articles.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton accused Barack Obama of deception and faulted his Senate record as new evidence of discord surfaced within her own camp.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senators Hillary Rodham Clinton and Barack Obama battled over national security and trade in a frantic burst of last-minute campaigning on Monday as Mrs. Clinton accused Mr. Obama of deception and new evidence of discord surfaced within her own camp.
articles.byline: By Elisabeth Bumiller and John M. Broder

articles.headline: Unlike Consumers, Companies Are Piling Up Cash
articles.snippet: The typical American corporation probably has increased its savings enough to completely pay off its debts.
articles.abstract: The typical American corporation probably has increased its savings enough to completely pay off its debts.
articles.lead_paragraph: At least someone knows how to fill a piggy bank.

articles.headline: Oil Tops Inflation-Adjusted Record Set in 1980
articles.snippet: Capping a relentless rise in recent years, oil prices hit a record high of $103.95 a barrel on Monday, then pulled back to close below the record.
articles.abstract: Capping a relentless rise in recent years, oil prices hit a record high of $103.95 a barrel on Monday, then pulled back to close below the record.
articles.lead_paragraph: Capping a relentless rise in recent years, oil prices hit a record high during the day on Monday, then pulled back to close below the record.

articles.headline: A Bug Rises, and With It a Company
articles.snippet: Patients might not like the new admission procedure at a growing number of hospitals: having an elongated Q-Tip stuck up their noses. But it smells great to Cepheid.
articles.abstract: Patients might not like the new admission procedure at a growing number of hospitals: having an elongated Q-Tip stuck up their noses. But it smells great to Cepheid.
articles.lead_paragraph: Patients might not particularly like the new admission procedure at a growing number of hospitals: having what looks like an elongated Q-Tip stuck up their noses. But it smells great to Cepheid.
